dcterms:creator: A. Garivier
O. Cappé
dcterms:description: The Bernoulli distribution is used in the context of multi-armed bandits to model rewards, where observations are realizations from a Bernoulli distribution with parameter f.
dcterms:title: Bernoulli distribution

dcterms:creator: S. R. Chowdhury
A. Gopalan
dcterms:description: Kernelized Bandits (KBs) optimize a function in the Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Space (RKHS) and focus on the case where observations are subject to subgaussian noise.
dcterms:title: Kernelized Bandits (KBs)

dcterms:creator: L. Faury
M. Abeille
K. Jun
C. Calauzènes
dcterms:description: Logistic Bandits are used to develop jointly efficient and optimal algorithms for scenarios where the reward structure is logistic.
dcterms:title: Logistic Bandits

dcterms:creator: C. E. Rasmussen
C. K. I. Williams
dcterms:description: Gaussian Processes (GPs) are utilized for machine learning tasks, providing a framework for regression and classification problems.
dcterms:title: Gaussian Processes (GPs)

dcterms:creator: S. Magureanu
R. Combes
A. Proutière
dcterms:description: Lipschitz bandits are studied for their regret lower bound and optimal algorithms, focusing on the Lipschitz continuity of the reward functions.
dcterms:title: Lipschitz bandits

dcterms:creator: N. L. Hjort
dcterms:description: Beta processes are used in nonparametric Bayesian models, particularly in survival analysis and life history data.
dcterms:title: Beta processes

dcterms:creator: R. Kleinberg
A. Slivkins
E. Upfal
dcterms:description: Multi-armed bandits in metric spaces extend the traditional multi-armed bandit problem to settings where the arms are points in a metric space.
dcterms:title: Multi-armed bandits in metric spaces

dcterms:creator: A. G. Wilson
Z. Ghahramani
dcterms:description: Gaussian Process Copulas provide a framework for modeling dependencies between random variables using Gaussian processes.
dcterms:title: Gaussian Process Copulas
